results.title: Eat, drink and be wary
results.brief_description: This film examines some of the problems associated with modern man’s increased reliance on manufactured and processed foods. Discusses the issues of additives, food processing, and the changes taking place in the American diet

results.title: Farm machinery safety
results.creator_credit: Reg Barrett, Allen Keen and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1970 film examines safety factors relating to farm machinery. The film outlines safety features of tractors, including overhead protective frames, guards, maintenance, braking, safety belts and hitching, as well as the importance of guards on a variety of large pieces of farm machinery. The footage includes tractors being used on the farm and examples of common accidents that can occur, inlcuding several scenes of tractors overturning in the field. Of particular interest are the examples of machinery used in the 1960s, including Ford and Massey-Ferguson tractors, the footage of testing on Rheem overhead protective frames and scenes of large dairy farms in New South Wales.

Produced by the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry and presented by the Rural Safety Advisory Service.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: A Banking career
results.creator_credit: Harley H. Davidson, Frederick Daniel and Artransa Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the various functions of a bank; the daily routine of business, and the responsibility of various bank officers. The latter part of the film lists the various advantages of making banking a career, mentioning rates of pay, special bonuses, opportunities for advancement, medical and sick leave benefits, pensions on retirement and the social life among bank personnel.

results.title: Trapper Murphy
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Describes the menace to sheep of dingoes and foxes in the Bogong High Plains in Victoria and shows something of the way in which they are being exterminated. Includes a shot of dingoes actually killing sheep at night.

Please be advised: this film includes scenes of animals being hunted and destroyed which may be distressing to viewers.

results.title: On Paper
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, Michael Bongiovanni, Ray Harris, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
The connecting link in this video is photography, and the different approaches Micky Allan, Sally Robinson, Mandy Martin and Jenny Watson have to producing works on paper using photography either directly or indirectly

results.title: Tom Arthur
results.creator_credit: National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Tom Arthur’s art is for him a visual way of reasoning. By using the associated symbolic meanings and cultural connotations attached to specific objects and images he attempts to examine and question belief structures and systems of knowledge and how society forces these into its members. For Tom Arthur there are no absolutes, and everything seems relative

results.title: Robert Boynes
results.creator_credit: Alan Cole, Ken Otton, Lloyd Carrick and Robert Lindsay
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Boynes is often grouped with a number of Australian artists who, working from the mid 1960’s, are referred to as “Australian Pop” artists. Australian pop has its own distinct flavour, different from the U.S. and U.K. schools, and related to the Australian environment
